Author: yuvadeep
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Now a day, everybody wants to store their sensitive data from unauthorized expose. Memority is a blockchain platform offers secure space for the sensitive data which integrates with a technology named as blockchain. Therefore, the system helps to store 10 copies of files on separate storages at every time all over the world. Thus, to encrypt all the files they use a private key, and they designed Memority in such a way that they can receive only by their owner at the time of account is created. As the data is in the encrypted format it is not possible to access the data. To access the data we need to decrypt the data with the help of the private key. Memority main aim is to create an independent ecosystem that involves many applications that can be helpful not only for business but also for Government authorities and can store all types of data in an ultra-secure storage. Memority platform gives an opportunity to secure sensitive data and this can be done by applying four features they are  1) Private key encryption 2) Forgery protection 3) Accidental deletion safeguards 4) Self-containment and independence  Thus, this platform will allow participating in third-party sellers to develop data storage applications on the platform. Therefore, this platform uses very low-cost mining technology that is equally helpful to balance the costly mining equipment. Miners help in receiving the rewards which are in the form of MMR tokens for behind the working volume of the blockchain executing their power.

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Hello,  thank you for your question.  Yes, Memority is an Ethereum based project. Please visit our bounty program following the link https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3915297

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Hello, thank you for your questions. Yes, Memority is Ethereum based project. Yes we have bounty program. The link to it is https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3952669. At the moment we need the translation of the content of the website Undelete (a website that helps promote Memority), not a big piece of text. Moreover,  and we need you to find 100 top  news websites and 200 social accounts of most popular people in your country (it can be actors, bussinessmen, politicians, sportsman, CEO of different companies and everyone who has a lot of followers in social media).In return you will be accrued 2000  Ethereum Memority Tokens. Could you please tell me what is your native language? I am looking forward to your kind reply. Best regards

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Hello. Thank you for your questions. The thing is that our hosters  store all the files and they  take care of 10  copies of files to be save simultaneously. On blockchain only administrative data is stored. You can have an access to your file only using your private key.

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Hello. Thank you for your question. Our presale was ended on May 30, 2018. At the moment we are running ICO.

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Hello. Yes, they will appear since bounty program is active. If you still do not see your details in bounty participants table please contact @sasha_noch

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Hello. Thank you for your answer. Yes, sure. In order to prevent it a user needs to  make a deposit if he wants to  upload a file. So this attack is unlikely to happen.

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Hello. Thank you for your question. It solves the problem of safe and secure data storage. Memority is the only company that allows users to store data without worrying that someone else might delete, modify or view it. It does this by encrypting data with a private key, and creating 10 file copies with independent monitoring systems that make sure the data is neither modified or lost.

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Hello. Thank you for your question. Memority has a lot of advantages in front of its competitors. Here are some of them: 1. Decentralized process of file copies checking and restoration 2. Interface for third-party app developers 3. Material rewards for third-party app developers 4. Storage safety and files restoration independent from file owners 5.                          Complete independence from centralized systems 6.                          Files’ hash-codes storage in blockchain for data authenticity verification

Author: CryptoWisperer
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: This project is very wonderful, data storage on the blockchain.   It has a very huge potential, it can distrupt & revolutionalize the cloud storage market, with the advantage of storage on the blockchain, which will be more secure than centralized storage systems.  But I think there is something missing in this project. I have read the info on the website and the WhitePaper, I did not find features about data storage from mobile devices.   Note that more than 80% of data owners worldwide now use mobile devices, i e, smart phones, tablets, etc. People store data on their smart devices such as: photos, videos, etc. And they'll also like to store them online so as to prevent loss of their precious files which can happen due to accidental data loss or phone theft.   I will expect this project to create mobile apps for storing data on the memority blockchain, using android app, ios app, windows app, etc. Most centralized storage systems such as: microsoft onedrive, google drive, yandex disc, amazon cloud drive, etc, all have mobile apps.   A decentralized system will always be better & more secure than centralized storage sites, and connecting mobile devices to the blockchain will also be an added advantage.   It's never too late, project development is a long precedure, the devs can still add this feature to the project development roadmap.

Author: Jondum
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Memority is a platform for decentralized data storage. Unique data identifiers are stored in the blockchain database, the system regularly searches forgeries and returns the correct number of copies with the original data if the file has been falsified.

Author: CryptoWisperer
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: There have been some earlier projects that aim to decentralized data storage, but what I admire about the Memority project is its unique concept. The uniqueness makes it different from other blockchain projects.   The mining method is Proof-Of-Authority, which means that there is no need for large computing resources, this method of mining does not incur expensive costs to manage.   Also the data hosters will earn MMR tokens for providing their disc space to users of the Memority platform for storing their data.

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Yes, out ICO is divided in terms, each 31 days long. And each has a different coin price (based on bonus amount for that term). Generally speaking, they go like this: June 10 EMT = 0.87 USD, July 10 EMT = 0.91 USD, August 10 EMT = 0.95 USD and September 10 EMT = 1 USD.   Quote from: melomanskiy on June 03, 2018, 06:51:45 PM Tell me, please, on the audience of which part of the planet you are aimed in the first place and why?  First world countries. There are more businesses there and they are more technologically developed so they are more likely to require ultra-secure storages. Pretty much the same with governmental institutions, they are more digitized and thus require secure storage more. And people should be more conscience about their personal data protection.  Quote from: polonez on June 03, 2018, 08:29:11 PM When do you anticipate a minimal viable product (MVP) will be released?  It has been, in April. Here: https://memority.io/alpha By August 1st we will also release a public beta.

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: iOS and Android - yes, for sure, but Windows phone - obviously not, as even Microsoft does not support this platform anymore.  Quote from: EvRo74 on June 04, 2018, 11:01:20 AM Quote from: Maxperelygin on May 24, 2018, 07:39:42 PM Hello! Very promising company, good team, will be working with them, I advise you to join! Do not miss your chance to become part of the team! The company has very interesting ideas, which you can read by subscribing to groups in social networks!   You write a "good team", but how do you understand this? Do you know them personally? I didn`t find any information about the composition of the team and their experience. Can you help me find this info?  Why, how about our website?  https://memority.io/ You can find our team with their LinkedIns there.  Quote from: Mr.Ease on June 10, 2018, 09:04:00 PM I see you guys have raised over 4.5mil and are approaching the soft-cap.  When does the sale end?  Is the timer with 20days remaining only for the bonus period?   It is for the first ICO period. The whole ICO goes on until October 1st and is devided into four 31-day long periods (+15-day long Pre-ICO). Each period has a decreasing bonus amount (15%, 10%, 5% and no bonus).

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Thanks for the hint, I will do so. Quote from: Luvr1000 on June 10, 2018, 11:14:25 PM I agree with all the comments, there is a similar project and he already has a working product, but the fees are slow, you need new ideas to get around all the rivals  We also have a working MVP, and most importantly our project is different and better in several ways: we ensure independent decentralized monitoring over files availability and authenticity. And their restoration is also decentralized and independent, in case hosts drop out. And finally, we provide a platform for third-party developers. No other project does these things. The topic was inactive for quite a while at the beginning, so I did not pay much attention. And it is managed by a team member. Now I'll be checking the topic daily.

Author: Somz1
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: In simple terms explain me how data storage can works on Blockchain, also is there a method to access this cloud storage with the use of internet? If it can't, how is it better than existing cloud storage platforms like Google Drive, 1Drive etc?

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Well that's uncalled for. Your accusations seem to lack actual arguments. Did you actually come to these conclusions by analyzing something (if yes, then what?) or you just emotionally decided to blame the first thing that came to your mind? Also, very weird that you accuse all ICOs yet have a signature promoting one of them    Quote from: Somz1 on June 14, 2018, 11:55:14 AM In simple terms explain me how data storage can works on Blockchain, also is there a method to access this cloud storage with the use of internet? If it can't, how is it better than existing cloud storage platforms like Google Drive, 1Drive etc?  Files are uploaded to hosts (be it hosting providers or just other people with spare hard drive space), they are encrypted and their hash is calculated and written into a distributed blockchain ledger. Those hash codes are later used to check files integrity and authenticity. Afterwards, basically, our monitoring systems continuously check stored files and if anything is amiss - they independently reupload files to new hosts, kicking "bad" ones. By accessing via Internet you mean like Web interface? How is our storage better than Google Drive and others? Well, 3 points: 1. You can not lose your data or access to it. 2. Nobody can see you data, delete of modify it, and so on. 3. No single corporation holds you data and profits from you, Memority is completely decentralized and after release will belong only to its users.

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Thank you for the kind words! We are planning to make the best decetralized storage available and we are happy to answer all questions from our community.  Quote from: cfif on June 16, 2018, 10:58:34 PM Quote from: olsyd on June 01, 2018, 04:16:03 PM I'm very impressed with Memority main features: - data encryption with private key; - accidental deletion protection by making multiple copies; - protection from forgery by using a blockchain; - making self-contained and independent system by its decentralization.  The focus on security is a very accurate decision in the information epoch. I'm sure your project will lead cloud storages to the new level. Brilliant project and I recommend it to all who looks for a project for investment!  Yes, it is a real interest project, like others security data tokens. But when he is will be listed on Markets? For example, security token, like a REMME was added to Market, when you make it?  We have listing agreements with EXMO and several smaller exchanges, and we are negotiating much more. We plan to get listed before the end of ICO.

Author: memority
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Hi! Thank you for a good question. That attacker will be required to pay for at least 2 weeks of storage of those files. So his "attack" will be kind of very beneficial for hosts and miners and us. We will also limit the minimum file size and maybe implement other limitations, but specifics on this will be decided when we have statistics on alpha and beta tests.

Author: jelbert1351
Title: [ANN][ICO]Memority - secure decentralized data storage on blockchain
Body: Im forseeing a lot of potentiality from this project for I myself is an avid fan of cloud services. Out in the market to date are dropbox and onedrive and maybe It is time to take tge game to a whole new level by leveraging blockchain and smart contracts. It is an indisputable fact that almost everyone loves taking pictures and saving files online, but we are aprehended of the pressing predicament most of the internet users nowadays. File was stolen, corrupted and even information were used by someone else. Security is the top priority the market is aiming for and with this, which makes use of blockchain and smart contract to support authenticy and security. Memority for sure will be one of the most promising projects this 2018 to watch for. Memority shall offer possibilities of saving and protecting our files in the internet. Who wouldnt want to bring their files everywhere they want to go? I bet, everyone will love it absolutely.
